pageContext.claim: “Without the tariffs, we would have had [no agreement with Mexico].”
pageContext.analysis: This is misleading. Much of the deal that was announced to avert Trump’s tariff threat had been agreed to in previous negotiations. The New York Times reported, “The Mexican government had already pledged to do that in March during secret talks in Miami between Kirstjen Nielsen, then the secretary of homeland security, and Olga Sanchez, the Mexican secretary of the interior, the officials said.”
